Join us for Still Separate, Still Unequal: Pursuing Racial Justice in Kansas.
  


Still Separate, Still Unequal:
Pursuing Racial Justice in Kansas

Fri., Oct. 5, 8:30 a.m. - 3:30 p.m.
Kansas City Kansas
Community College
7250 State Ave.
Kansas City, KS 66112

RSVP Today
Share this:           

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

There’s still time and space to register for our conference on racial justice in Kansas this Friday, October 5. We have 25 local and national experts from academia, the legislature, law enforcement, and advocacy communities to discuss a range of topics, including racial justice in Kansas history and legislation, representation and diversity in power, and racial profiling and policing.

Over lunch, we'll have a keynote speech on mass incarceration from Wesley Bell, an outspoken advocate of criminal justice reform, a member of the Board of Aldermen in Ferguson, Missouri. Visit our website for a full list of speakers and the day’s agenda.

The event will run from 8:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. in the Upper Jewell Center and is free and open to the public.

Lunch will be provided. Space is limited, so register today.

We hope to see you there.

Micah Kubic
Executive Director
ACLU of Kansas
